column4: Can anyone tell me why i must use sudo su to echo -n 95 > /proc/acpi/video/GFX0/DD03/brightness
sudo does not work nor, sudo -s
because > gets processed by the shell, which doesn't have any root permissions.
you can use, instead, either « sudo sh -c "command > /proc/whatever" »,  or you can use « sudo command | tee /proc/whatever » to circumvent that
anyway I can get sudo to not ask a password so I can make that in to a script?
that would be quite dangerous. are you intending to do that every time you start your computer?
um, no ... on command for several different settings.
not making it ask for a password is going to be tricky.
err, im sorry. the real reason this is all going on is because I have absolutelty no idea how to make my laptop function keys work
which laptop is that? there are some packages for that in the repos
uhm no i can't find anything (doesn't mean there isn't, just isn't exceptionally easy to find)
hmm ok. bright up is fn+f8 down is f7 so. how would I want to go about making that + fn work?
